intro: Petrophile rigida, commonly known as the rigid heath, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal and heathland environments. Petrophile rigida is well adapted to dry conditions and is an important component of its native ecosystems.
